text: Python: What's the fastest way to zip right to left, and is there no builtin for this?

code:
In [933]: c = zip(reversed(a),reversed(b))
In [934]: [x for x in reversed(c)]
Out[934]: [(1, 5), (2, 6), (3, 7)]

text: But I don't like the idea of using reversed on all my input parameters, and I also don't want to re-implement my own zip function.
